body.p:
Louisville, Ky
March 13.th 1862.
Jas W. Tate Esqr.
My dear Sir:
Inclosed I send you $1. -- Will you do me the favor to request the Governor to appoint me a Notary Public
As I have never been honored with an introduction to his Excellency or yourself, it may be proper that, in making this request, I should give some reference.
I am well acquainted with Jas Speed Esqr. Nathl Wolfe Esqr Mr Joshua Tevis -- in fact all of our Legislators from this City.
I simply desire to be a notary as a matter of convenience to Enable ^me^ to administer Oaths to my clients in such law business as I may have to transact.
Permit me also to ask of you another favor -- to have the Enclosed petition delivered to the Governor.
Should he grant the remission, I would be glad to have it mailed to my address.

I defended Murphy & think that under the law which allows the Carrying of concealed weapons in certain cases, he ought not to have been fined, and as he ^has^ already paid the costs & that part of the fine which goes to the City Atto, he is not doing amiss to ask Executive Clemency.

Yrs very truly
Rob't J. Elliott
